Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2009 04:29AM queenlurker wrote: ashleyaz. You are a smart lady to look into all these options-hopefully you will end up with a neg biopsy. Have heard many good things about Dr Zannis but he may take a while to get in . (if you are looking for peace of mind. ) I was very disapointed in Mayo Clinic Scottsdale-please PM me if you are planning to persue them.  Although I have heard good things about reconstruction there. Good luck in whatever you decide.
Posts.Title: order of consults/tests/events... ashleyaz ashleyaz

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 07:07PM queenlurker wrote: scoobydo, Everyone is different but I had an easier time with the DD AC.  Had the taxotere for 12 weekly treatments.  Most of my complaints were with the steroids though.  Didn't need any neupogen and my hair was auctually growing back.  Kept my brows and the lashes were short but lost most of my nails.  Could not keep up my exercise program for the last 2-3 weeks due to weak legs and was totally wiped out.  All in all it was worth it to be able to say the beast is gone-God willing for good.  By the way our stats are quite close.  Hoping you have an easier time with the same results.
Posts.Title: T VS AC? Scoobydoo chinablue

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2009 08:18AM queenlurker wrote: scoobydo, Just want you to know that I really felt like the taxotere  was working for me-the onc wanted to change it but I wouldn't let her.  That is really what kept me going-I knew it was working.  Do I do anything different now?  Not really, have some osteopenia which I take my Calcium and vit d for but exercised and ate healthy before all this happened.  The more I read about vit d the more I like it.  I do not even take a multi vit-prefer everything in my meals (and fresh), auctually I am probably a little OCD about it.  Good luck to you and keep me posted-are you going to have rads?
Posts.Title: T VS AC? Scoobydoo chinablue
